p: Bezerra et al. [ 92] evaluated the use of yellow passion fruit albedo flour, with important pectin content, as encapsulating component for the development of nanodispersions of carotenoid extract from Spirulina sp. LEB 18. Nanodispersions were characterized for their stability, antioxidant capacity, physicochemical features and retention of carotenoids after 60 days of storage at 4 Â°C. Concluding remark identified flour as a natural alternative to commercial polymers, containing the possibility of their introduction into several food formulations.
